original: saṃvartamāne loke yadbhūyasā satvā ābhāsvare devanikāye upapadyante /
analyzed: saṃvartamāne loke yat bhūyasā satvāḥ ābhāsvare devanikāye upapadyante
translated: When the world is dissolving, beings are mostly reborn in the Ābhāsvara class of gods.

original: te tatra bhavanti rūpiṇo manomayāḥ avikalā ahīnendriyāḥ sarvāṅgapratyaṅgopetāḥ śubhā
analyzed: te tatra bhavanti rūpiṇaḥ manaḥ mayāḥ avikalāḥ ahīna indriyāḥ sarva aṅga pratyaṅga upetāḥ śubhāḥ
translated: They are there with form, mind-made, complete with all limbs and faculties, not deficient in any way.

original: varṇasthāyinaḥ svayaṃprabhā vihāyasaṃgamāḥ prītibhakṣāḥ prītyāhārāḥ dīrghāyuṣo dīrgham
analyzed: varṇa sthāyinaḥ svayaṃprabhāḥ vihāyasaṃgamāḥ prīti bhakṣāḥ prīti āhārāḥ dīrgha āyuṣaḥ dīrgham
translated: They are of beautiful appearance, self-luminous, moving through the air, feeding on joy, abiding in a state of bliss, and living a long time.

analyzed: adhvānam tiṣṭhanti
translated: They remain for a long time.

original: tena khalu samayeneyaṃ mahāpṛthivī ekodakā bhavaty ekārṇavā /
analyzed: tena khalu samayena iyam mahā pṛthivī ekodakā bhavati eka arṇavā
translated: At that time, this great earth becomes a single ocean, a single expanse of water.

analyzed: yaḥ khalu
translated: The wind from above,

analyzed: eka uda kāyā
translated: on the single ocean,

original: mahāpṛthivyā ekārṇavāyā upari vāyunā saraḥ saṃgacchati saṃmūrchati santanoti tadyathā payasaḥ pakvasya śītībhūtasya upari vāyunā saraḥ saṃgacchati 🔽saṃmūrchati santanoti /
analyzed: mahā pṛthivyāḥ eka arṇavāyāḥ upari vāyunā saraḥ saṃgacchati saṃmūrchati santanoti tat yathā payasaḥ pakvasya śītībhūtasya upari vāyunā saraḥ saṃgacchati  saṃmūrchati santanoti
translated: on the great earth, a single expanse of water, gathers, condenses, and spreads out, just as on the surface of boiled milk that has cooled down, the wind gathers, condenses, and spreads out.

original: evam ekodakāyā mahāpṛthivyā ekārṇavāyā upari vāyunā saraḥ saṃgacchati saṃmūrcchati santanoti /
analyzed: evam ekodakāyāḥ mahā pṛthivyāḥ eka arṇavāyāḥ upari vāyunā saraḥ saṃgacchati saṃmūrcchati santanoti
translated: In the same way, on the single ocean, on the great earth, a single expanse of water, the wind gathers, condenses, and spreads out from above.

original: sa bhavati pṛthivīraso varṇasaṃpanno gandhasaṃpanno rasasaṃpannaḥ /
analyzed: sa bhavati pṛthivī rasaḥ varṇa saṃpannaḥ gandha saṃpannaḥ rasa saṃpannaḥ
translated: It becomes the essence of the earth, perfect in color, perfect in smell, perfect in taste.

analyzed: evaṃrūpaḥ varṇena tat yathā navanītam
translated: It has such a color, like fresh butter.

analyzed: evaṃrūpaḥ rasena tat yathā kṣaudra madhu an eḍakam
translated: It has such a taste, like pure honey or ghee.

original: bhavati gautamā sa samayo yad ayaṃ loko vivartate /
analyzed: bhavati gautamā sa samayaḥ yat ayam lokaḥ vivartate
translated: Gautama, there is a time when this world expands.

original: vivartamāne loke tata eke satvā āyuḥkṣayāt karmakṣayāt puṇyakṣayād ābhāsvarād A
analyzed: vivartamāne loke tatas eke satvāḥ āyuḥ kṣayāt karma kṣayāt puṇya kṣayāt ābhāsvarāt a
translated: When the world is expanding, some beings, due to the exhaustion of their lifespan, karma, and merit, fall from the Ābhāsvara

original: devanikāyāc cyutvā ittham āgacchanti mānuṣyāṇāṃ sabhāgatāyām /
analyzed: devanikāyāt cyutvā ittham āgacchanti mānuṣyāṇām sabhā gatāyām
translated: heaven realm and come to this world, taking on the nature of humans.

original: te iha bhavanti rūpiṇo manomayā avikalā ahīnendriyāḥ sarvāṅgapratyaṅgopetāḥ śubhā🔽varṇasthāyinaḥ svayaṃprabhā vihāyasaṃgamāḥ prītibhakṣāḥ prītyāhārāḥ dīrghāyuṣo dīrgham
analyzed: te iha bhavanti rūpiṇaḥ manaḥ mayāḥ avikalāḥ ahīna indriyāḥ sarva aṅga pratyaṅga upetāḥ śubhā  varṇa sthāyinaḥ svayaṃprabhāḥ vihāyasaṃgamāḥ prīti bhakṣāḥ prīti āhārāḥ dīrgha āyuṣaḥ dīrgham
translated: Here they are embodied, born of mind, complete in all limbs and faculties, with all major and minor parts of the body intact,🔽abiding in a beautiful form, self-luminous, moving through the sky, subsisting on joy, nourished by joy, long-lived, remaining for a long

analyzed: adhvānam tiṣṭhanti
translated: time.

original: tena khalu samayena na sūryācandramasor loke prādurbhāvo bhavati /
analyzed: tena khalu samayena na sūryācandramasoḥ loke prādurbhāvaḥ bhavati
translated: At that time, the sun and moon do not appear in the world,

analyzed: na nakṣatrāṇām
translated: nor do the stars.

analyzed: na kṣaṇa lava muhūrtānām
translated: Nor do the moments, seconds, and hours.

analyzed: na rātrindivasānām
translated: Nor do the days and nights.

analyzed: na māsa ardha māsa ritu saṃvatsarāṇām loke prādurbhāvaḥ bhavati
translated: Nor do the months, half-months, seasons, and years appear in the world.

original: na strī prajñāyate na puruṣo nānyatra satvaḥ satva iti saṃkhyā gacchati /🔽The tasting of the pṛthivīrasa
analyzed: na strī prajñāyate na puruṣaḥ na anyatra satvaḥ satvaḥ iti saṃkhyā gacchati 🔽the tasting of the pṛthivīrasa
translated: There is no distinction between female and male, but beings are simply counted as beings.

original: athānyatamo lolupajātīyaḥ satvaḥ pṛthivīrasam aṅgulyagreṇāsvādayati /🔽yathā yathāsvādayati tathā tathā rocayate /
analyzed: atha anyatamaḥ lolupa jātīyaḥ satvaḥ pṛthivī rasam aṅguli agreṇa āsvādayati  yathā yathā āsvādayati tathā tathā rocayate
translated: Then, a certain being of a greedy nature tasted the earth's essence with the tip of his finger.🔽As he tasted it, he became attracted to it.

original: yathā yathā rocayate tathā tathā kavaḍīkārāhāropakrameṇa paribhuṅkte /
analyzed: yathā yathā rocayate tathā tathā kavaḍīkāra āhāra upakrameṇa paribhuṅkte
translated: As he became attracted to it, he consumed it by the method of oral food.

original: adrākṣur anye 'pi satvā taṃ satvaṃ pṛthivīrasam aṅgulyagreṇāsvādayamānaṃ yathā yathāsvādayati tathā tathā rocayate /
analyzed: adrākṣuḥ anye pi satvā tam satvam pṛthivī rasam aṅguli agreṇa āsvādayamānam yathā yathā āsvādayati tathā tathā rocayate
translated: Other beings saw that being tasting the earth's essence with the tip of his finger, as he tasted it he became attracted to it,

original: yathā yathā rocayate tathā tathā kavaḍīkāropakrameṇa paribhuktavān iti /
analyzed: yathā yathā rocayate tathā tathā kavaḍīkāra upakrameṇa paribhuktavān iti
translated: as he became attracted to it, he consumed it by the method of oral food.

original: dṛṣṭvā ca punas te satvāḥ pṛthivīrasam aṅgulyagreṇa āsvādayitum ārabdhāḥ /🔽yathā yathāsvādayanti tathā tathā rocayante /
analyzed: dṛṣṭvā ca punar te satvāḥ pṛthivī rasam aṅguli agreṇa āsvādayitum ārabdhāḥ  yathā yathā āsvādayanti tathā tathā rocayante
translated: Having seen that, those beings also began to taste the earth's essence with the tip of their fingers.🔽As they tasted it, they became attracted to it.

original: yathā yathā rocayante tataḥ kavaḍīkāropakrameṇa paribhuktavantaḥ /
analyzed: yathā yathā rocayante tatas kavaḍīkāra upakrameṇa paribhuktavantaḥ
translated: As they became attracted to it, they consumed it by the method of oral food.

original: yatas ca te satvāḥ pṛthivīrasaṃ kavaḍīkārāhāropakrameṇa paribhuktās tatas teṣāṃ satvānāṃ kharatvaṃ ca gurutvaṃ ca kāye 'vakrāntam /
analyzed: yatas ca te satvāḥ pṛthivī rasam kavaḍīkāra āhāra upakrameṇa paribhuktāḥ tatas teṣām satvānām khara tvam ca guru tvam ca kāye vakra antam
translated: From the time those beings consumed the earth's essence by the method of oral food, then roughness and heaviness entered their bodies.

analyzed: teṣām yā asau śubhā varṇa nibhā sā antarhitā
translated: Their beautiful complexion disappeared.

analyzed: andhakāram loke prādurbhūtam
translated: Darkness appeared in the world.

original: dharmatā khalu gautamā andhakārasya loke prādurbhāvāt sūryācandramasor loke prādurbhāvo bhavati /
analyzed: dharmatā khalu gautamāḥ andhakārasya loke prādurbhāvāt sūryācandramasoḥ loke prādurbhāvaḥ bhavati
translated: It is a natural law that when darkness appears in the world, the sun and moon appear in the world.

original: nakṣatrāṇāṃ kṣaṇalavamuhūrtānāṃ rātrindivasānāṃ māsārdhamāsaritusaṃvatsarāṇāṃ loke prādurbhāvo bhavati SBV I /
analyzed: nakṣatrāṇām kṣaṇa lava muhūrtānām rātrin divasānām māsa ardha māsa ritu saṃvatsarāṇām loke prādurbhāvaḥ bhavati sbu i
translated: The stars, moments, seconds, hours, days and nights, months, fortnights, seasons, and years appear in the world.

original: te tadbhakṣās tadāhārā dīrghāyuṣo dīrgham adhvānaṃ tiṣṭhanti /
analyzed: te tad bhakṣāḥ tad āhārāḥ dīrgha āyuṣaḥ dīrgham adhvānam tiṣṭhanti
translated: They, having that as food, that as sustenance, lived for a long time, for a long period.

original: teṣāṃ yo 'lpataram āhāram āharati sa varṇavān bhavati /
analyzed: teṣām yaḥ lpataram āhāram āharati sa varṇavān bhavati
translated: Among them, the one who ate less food became beautiful.

original: yaḥ prabhūtataram āhāram āharati sa durvarṇo bhavati /
analyzed: yaḥ prabhūtataram āhāram āharati sa durvarṇaḥ bhavati
translated: The one who ate more food became ugly.

analyzed: iti āhāra dvi mātra tām pratītya varṇa dvi mātra tā prajñāyate
translated: Thus, depending on the twofold measure of food, the twofold measure of complexion is known.

analyzed: varṇa dvi mātra tāyām satyām satvaḥ satvam avamanyate
translated: When there is a twofold measure of complexion, a being despises another being:

analyzed: hambhoḥ satva varṇavān aham
translated: Oh, being, I am beautiful.

analyzed: duvarṇaḥ tvam iti
translated: You are ugly.

original: teṣāṃ varṇābhimānikānāṃ satāṃ teṣām eva pāpakānām akuśalānāṃ dharmāṇāṃ samādānahetoḥ pṛthivīraso 'ntarhitaḥ /
analyzed: teṣām varṇa abhimānikānām satām teṣām eva pāpakānām akuśalānām dharmāṇām samādāna hetoḥ pṛthivī rasaḥ ntarhitaḥ
translated: For those beings who were conceited about their caste, because of undertaking those same bad and unwholesome dharmas, the essence of the earth disappeared.

original: antarhite pṛthivīrase te satvāḥ saṃgamya samāgamya śocanti klāmyanti paridevante /
analyzed: antarhite pṛthivī rase te satvāḥ saṃgamya samāgamya śocanti klāmyanti paridevante
translated: When the essence of the earth disappeared, those beings, having come together and assembled, lamented, grieved, and wailed.

original: evaṃ cāhur aho rasa aho rasa iti /
analyzed: evam ca āhuḥ aho rasa aho rasaḥ iti
translated: And they said, Oh, the essence! Oh, the essence!

original: tadyathaitarhi manuṣyāḥ kiṃcid eva svādu subhojanaṃ bhuktvā tad eva purāṇam akṣarapadavyañjanam anusmaranta evam āhur aho rasa aho rasa iti
analyzed: tat yathā etarhi manuṣyāḥ kiṃcid eva svādu su bhojanam bhuktvā tat eva purāṇam akṣara pada vyañjanam anusmarantaḥ evam āhuḥ aho rasa aho rasaḥ iti
translated: Just as people these days, having eaten some delicious food, remember that very same old word, syllable, and letter, and say, Oh, the essence! Oh, the essence!

original: evaṃ te satvā antarhite gautamā pṛthivīrase saṃgamya samāgamya śocanti klāmyanti paridevante /
analyzed: evam te satvāḥ antarhite gautamā pṛthivī rase saṃgamya samāgamya śocanti klāmyanti paridevante
translated: In the same way, Gautama, when the essence of the earth disappeared, those beings, having come together and assembled, lamented, grieved, and wailed.

original: evaṃ cāhur aho rasa aho rasa iti /
analyzed: evam ca āhuḥ aho rasa aho rasaḥ iti
translated: And they said, Oh, the essence! Oh, the essence!

analyzed: artham ca asya na jānanti
translated: But they did not understand its meaning.

analyzed: ayam asya bhāṣitasya arthaḥ yam asya bhāṣitasya arthaḥ iti
translated: This is the meaning of this statement. This is the meaning of this statement.

analyzed: the appearance of the pṛthivīparpaṭake etc
translated: The appearance of the earth-cake, etc.

analyzed: teṣām yaḥ lpataram āhāram āharati sa varṇavān bhavati  yaḥ prabhūtam āhāram āharati sa durvarṇaḥ bhavati iti āhāra dvi mātra tām pratītya varṇa dvi mātra tā prajñāyate
translated: Among them, the one who eats less food becomes beautiful.🔽The one who eats more food becomes ugly. Thus, on the basis of the variety of food, the variety of beauty is seen.

analyzed: varṇa dvi mātra tāyām satyām satvaḥ satvam avamanyate
translated: When there is a variety of beauty, a being despises another being.

analyzed: hambhoḥ satva varṇavān aham
translated: Hey being, I am beautiful.

analyzed: durvarṇaḥ tvam iti
translated: You are ugly.

translated: For those beings who have a sense of pride in beauty, due to the adoption of those same evil and unwholesome qualities, the forest creeper disappears.

original: antarhitāyāṃ vanalatāyāṃ te satvāḥ saṃgamya samāgamya śocanti klāmyanti paridevante /
analyzed: antarhitāyām vana latāyām te satvāḥ saṃgamya samāgamya śocanti klāmyanti paridevante
translated: When the forest creeper disappears, those beings, having come together and assembled, grieve, are exhausted, and lament.

original: evaṃ cāhur apaihi purastād apaihi purastād iti /
analyzed: evam ca āhuḥ apaihi purastāt apaihi purastāt iti
translated: They say, Go away, go away!

original: evam eva te satvā antarhitāyāṃ vanalatāyāṃ saṃgamya samāgamya śocanti klāmyanti paridevante /
analyzed: evam eva te satvāḥ antarhitāyām vana latāyām saṃgamya samāgamya śocanti klāmyanti paridevante
translated: In the same way, when the forest creeper disappears, those beings, having come together and assembled, grieve, are exhausted, and lament.

original: evaṃ āhur apaihi purastād apaihi purastād iti /
analyzed: evam āhuḥ apaihi purastāt apaihi purastāt iti
translated: Thus they say, Go away, go away!

analyzed: artham ca asya na jānanti
translated: And they do not understand his meaning.

original: ayam asya bhāṣitasyārtho 'yam asya bhāṣitasyārtha iti /
analyzed: ayam asya bhāṣitasya arthaḥ yam asya bhāṣitasya arthaḥ iti
translated: This is the meaning of his speech, this is the meaning of his speech.

original: antarhitāyāṃ gautamā vanalatāyāṃ teṣāṃ satvānām akṛṣṭoptaṃ taṇḍulaphalaśāliḥ prādurbhūta akaṇa atuṣaḥ śuddhaḥ śuciḥ caturaṅgulaḥ paryavanaddhaḥ🔽sa sāyaṃ lūnaḥ kālyaṃ pakvaś ca bhavati SBV I
analyzed: antarhitāyām gautamāḥ vana latāyām teṣām satvānām a kṛṣṭa uptam taṇḍula phala śāliḥ prādurbhūta a kaṇaḥ a tuṣaḥ śuddhaḥ śuciḥ caturaṅgulaḥ paryavanaddhaḥ  sa sāyam lūnaḥ kālyam pakvaḥ ca bhavati
translated: When the Gautama creeper disappeared, for those beings rice appeared, unplanted and uncultivated, with husks and grains, pure and clean, four fingers' breadth in size,

analyzed: prativirūḍhaḥ ca
translated: which was harvested in the evening and ripe in the morning,🔽and when harvested in the morning it was ripe in the evening.

original: kālyāṃ lūnaḥ sāyaṃ pakvaś ca bhavati prativirūḍhaś ca iti lūno lūnaḥ prativirohaty alūnaś ca prajñāyate /
analyzed: kālyām lūnaḥ sāyam pakvaḥ ca bhavati prativirūḍhaḥ ca iti lūnaḥ lūnaḥ prativirohati a lūnaḥ ca prajñāyate
translated: When harvested in the evening it was ripe in the morning, and when harvested in the morning it was ripe in the evening.

original: te tadbhakṣās tadāhārāḥ dīrghāyuṣo dīrgham adhvānaṃ tiṣṭhanti /
analyzed: te tad bhakṣāḥ tad āhārāḥ dīrgha āyuṣaḥ dīrgham adhvānam tiṣṭhanti
translated: They ate that, lived on that, and remained for a long time.

original: tataś ca te satvā akṛṣṭoptaṃ taṇḍulaphalaśāliṃ kavaḍīkārāhāropakrameṇa paribhuktavantaḥ /
analyzed: tatas ca te satvāḥ a kṛṣṭa uptam taṇḍula phala śālim kavaḍīkāra āhāra upakrameṇa paribhuktavantaḥ
translated: Then those beings, having eaten the rice with husks and grains,

analyzed: a tatas teṣām indriya nānātvam prādurbhūtam
translated: then diversity of faculties appeared among them.

analyzed: ekeṣām strī indriyam ekeṣām puruṣa indriyam
translated: Some had female faculties, some had male faculties.

original: tatra yeṣāṃ strīndriyaṃ yeṣāṃ ca puruṣendriyaṃ te 'nyonyaṃ cakṣuṣā cakṣur upanidhyāya paśyanti /
analyzed: tatra yeṣām strī indriyam yeṣām ca puruṣa indriyam te nyonyam cakṣuṣā cakṣuḥ upanidhyāya paśyanti
translated: There, those who have the female faculty and those who have the male faculty, they see each other's eyes with their eyes, and they look at each other's eyes.

original: ye yathā cakṣuṣā cakṣur upanidhyāya paśyanti tathā tathā saṃraktāḥ /🔽yathā yathā saṃraktās tathā tathāvadīrṇāḥ /
analyzed: ye yathā cakṣuṣā cakṣuḥ upanidhyāya paśyanti tathā tathā saṃraktāḥ  yathā yathā saṃraktāḥ tathā tathā avadīrṇāḥ
translated: As they see each other's eyes with their eyes, in the same way they become attached.🔽As they become attached, in the same way they become corrupted.

analyzed: yathā yathā avadīrṇāḥ tathā tathā vipratipannāḥ
translated: As they become corrupted, in the same way they engage in sexual misconduct.

original: adrākṣur anye 'pi satvāḥ satvaṃ satve vipratipannaṃ /
analyzed: adrākṣuḥ anye pi satvāḥ satvam satve vipratipannam
translated: Other beings saw a being engaging in sexual misconduct with another being.

original: dṛṣṭvā ca punaḥ pāṃśum api kṣipanti /
analyzed: dṛṣṭvā ca punar pāṃśum api kṣipanti
translated: And having seen, they threw dust,

original: loṣṭam api śarkarā api kapālāny api / evaṃ cāhuḥ /
analyzed: loṣṭam api śarkarāḥ api kapālāni api evam ca āhuḥ
translated: stones, gravel, and potsherds, and said:

original: dhig grāmyasatva akāryakāraka dhig grāmyasatva akāryakāraka katham idānīṃ tvaṃ bhoḥ satva satvaṃ dūṣayasīti /
analyzed: dhik grāmya satva akārya kāraka dhik grāmya satva akārya kāraka katham idānīm tvam bhoḥ satva satvam dūṣayasi iti
translated: Shame on you, village being, doing what should not be done! Shame on you, village being, doing what should not be done! How can you now, sir, corrupt another being?

original: tadyathaitarhi manuṣyā vadhukāyām udvāhyamānāyāṃ cūrṇam api kṣipanti gandham api mālyam api vastrajālāny api kṣipanti /
analyzed: tat yathā etarhi manuṣyāḥ vadhukāyām udvāhyamānāyām cūrṇam api kṣipanti gandham api mālyam api vastra jālāni api kṣipanti
translated: Just as now humans throw powder, perfume, garlands, and cloth nets when a bride is being married off.

original: evaṃ cāhuḥ sukhinī bhava vadhūke sukhinī bhava vadhūke iti /
analyzed: evam ca āhuḥ sukhinī bhava vadhūke sukhinī bhava vadhūke iti
translated: And they say: Be happy, bride! Be happy, bride!

original: evam eva te satvāḥ satvaṃ satve vipratipannaṃ dṛṣṭvā pāṃśum api kṣipanti /
analyzed: evam eva te satvāḥ satvam satve vipratipannam dṛṣṭvā pāṃśum api kṣipanti
translated: In the same way, when those beings saw a being acting wrongly towards another being, they threw dust on him,

original: loṣṭam api śarkarā api kapālāny api / evaṃ cāhuḥ /🔽dhig grāmyasatva
analyzed: loṣṭam api śarkarāḥ api kapālāni api evam ca āhuḥ  dhik grāmyasatva
translated: and clods of earth, and pebbles, and shards, and said:🔽'Shame on you, village being!

analyzed: dhik grāmya satva akārya kāraka
translated: Shame on you, village being, doing what should not be done!

original: katham idānīṃ tvaṃ bhoḥ satva satvaṃ dūṣayasīti /
analyzed: katham idānīm tvam bhoḥ satva satvam dūṣayasi iti
translated: How can you, sir, slander another being?'

original: iti hi gautamā yat pūrvam adharmasaṃmataṃ tad etarhi dharmasaṃmataṃ /
analyzed: iti hi gautamāḥ yat pūrvam adharma saṃmatam tat etarhi dharma saṃmatam
translated: Thus, Gautama, what was considered unrighteous before is now considered righteous,

original: yat pūrvam avinayasaṃmataṃ tad etarhi vinayasaṃmataṃ /
analyzed: yat pūrvam avinaya saṃmatam tat etarhi vinaya saṃmatam
translated: what was considered undisciplined before is now considered disciplined,

original: yat pūrvaṃ garhyasaṃmataṃ tad etarhi praśasyasaṃmatam /
analyzed: yat pūrvam garhya saṃmatam tat etarhi praśasya saṃmatam
translated: what was considered blameworthy before is now considered praiseworthy.

original: te tam ekāham api pravāsayanti dvis triḥ saptāham api pravāsayanti /
analyzed: te tam eka aham api pravāsayanti dvis tris sapta aham api pravāsayanti
translated: They banish him for one day, for two days, for seven days,

original: yataś ca te satvās tasmin pāpake asaddharme 'tyarthaṃ pātakavratam āpannās tatas te udyuktā agārāṇi māpayitum iha vayam akāryaṃ kariṣyāma iha
analyzed: yatas ca te satvāḥ tasmin pāpake asat dharme tyartham pātaka vratam āpannāḥ tatas te udyuktāḥ agārāṇi māpayitum iha vayam akāryam kariṣyāmaḥ iha
translated: and because those beings were so attached to that evil, unrighteous practice, they became eager to build houses, thinking 'Here we will do what should not be done,

analyzed: vayam akāryam kariṣyāmaḥ iti
translated: here we will do what should not be done.'

analyzed: agāram agāram iti saṃjñā udapādi
translated: The word 'house' (agāra) came into existence.

original: ayaṃ gautamā purāṇo 'graṇīr agāre SBV I
analyzed: ayam gautamā purāṇaḥ agāre sbu i
translated: This is the ancient and foremost Gautama, in the house,

analyzed: karmāntānām loke prādurbhāvaḥ
translated: The appearance of agricultural work in the world.

original: yataś ca te dharmeṇa nādharmeṇa tatrāyaṃ dharmaḥ śreṣṭho jinendrāṇāṃ /
analyzed: yatas ca te dharmeṇa na adharmeṇa tatra ayam dharmaḥ śreṣṭhaḥ jinendrāṇām
translated: And since that was by Dharma, not by Adharma, there this Dharma is foremost for the Victorious Ones.

original: te sāyaṃ ca sāyamāśārthinaḥ śālikāraṇāt samavasaranti prātaś ca prātarāśārthinaḥ /
analyzed: te sāyam ca sāyamāśa arthinaḥ śāli kāraṇāt samavasaranti prātar ca prātarāśa arthinaḥ
translated: And in the evening those seeking the evening meal gathered for rice, and in the morning those seeking the morning meal.

analyzed: atha anyatareṇa alasa jātīyena satvena sāyaṃprātikaḥ śāliḥ ānītaḥ
translated: Then a certain being of lazy nature brought rice for the evening and morning.

original: athānyataraḥ satvas taṃ satvam idam avocat /
analyzed: atha anyataraḥ satvaḥ tam satvam idam avocat
translated: Then another being said to that being:

original: ehi tvaṃ bhoḥ satva śālikāraṇāt samavasarāma iti /
analyzed: ehi tvam bhoḥ satva śāli kāraṇāt samavasarāmaḥ iti
translated: Come, friend being, let us gather for rice.

original: atha sa satvas tam idam avocat /
analyzed: atha sa satvaḥ tam idam avocat
translated: Then that being said to him:

original: pratijānīhi tvaṃ bhoḥ satva svaṃ śālim /
analyzed: pratijānīhi tvam bhoḥ satva svam śālim
translated: Promise, friend being, your own rice.

analyzed: ānītaḥ mayā sāyaṃprātikaḥ śāliḥ iti
translated: I have brought rice for the evening and morning.

analyzed: atha tasya satvasya etat abhavat
translated: Then this occurred to that being:

original: etad bata sādhv etad bata suṣṭhu yanv ahaṃ dvaiyahnikaṃ traiyahnikaṃ yāvat saptāhikaṃ śālim ānayeyam iti /
analyzed: etat bata sādhu etat bata suṣṭhu yanu aham dvaiyahnikam traiyahnikam yāvat saptāhikam śālim ānayeyam iti
translated: This is indeed good, this is indeed excellent. Let me now bring rice for two days, three days, up to seven days.

original: sa dvaiyahnikaṃ yāvat sāptāhikaṃ śālim ānītavān /
analyzed: sa dvaiyahnikam yāvat sāptāhikam śālim ānītavān
translated: He brought rice for two days, up to seven days.

original: athānyataraḥ satvas taṃ satvam idam avocat /
analyzed: atha anyataraḥ satvaḥ tam satvam idam avocat
translated: Then another being said to that being:

original: ehi tvaṃ bhoḥ satva śālikāraṇāt samavasarāma iti /
analyzed: ehi tvam bhoḥ satva śāli kāraṇāt samavasarāmaḥ iti
translated: Come, let us agree on a share of rice.

original: atha sa satvas tam idam avocat /
analyzed: atha sa satvaḥ tam idam avocat
translated: Then that being said to him:

original: pratijānīhi tvaṃ bhoḥ satva svaṃ śālim /
analyzed: pratijānīhi tvam bhoḥ satva svam śālim
translated: You agree on your own rice, sir.

original: ānīto mayā sa dvaiyahnikaṃ traiyahnikaṃ yāvat sāptāhnikaṃ śālir iti /
analyzed: ānītaḥ mayā sa dvaiyahnikam traiyahnikam yāvat sāptāhnikam śāliḥ iti
translated: I have brought rice for two days, three days, up to seven days.

analyzed: atha tasya satvasya etat abhavat
translated: Then that being thought:

original: etad bata sādhv etad bata A
analyzed: etat bata sādhu etat bata
translated: This is good, this is excellent.

original: suṣṭhu yanv ardhamāsikaṃ māsikaṃ śālim ānayeyam iti /
analyzed: suṣṭhu yanu ardha māsikam māsikam śālim ānayeyam iti
translated: Why don't I bring rice for half a month, for a month?

analyzed: saḥ ṛdh māsikam māsikam śālim ānītavān
translated: He brought rice for half a month, for a month.

original: yataś ca te satvā akṛṣṭoptaṃ taṇḍulaphalaśāliṃ saṃnidhīkāraparibhogena paribhuktās tatas tasya śāleḥ kaṇaś ca tuṣaś ca taṇḍulaṃ paryavanahyati /
analyzed: yatas ca te satvāḥ a kṛṣṭa uptam taṇḍula phala śālim saṃnidhīkāra paribhogena paribhuktāḥ tatas tasya śāleḥ kaṇaḥ ca tuṣaḥ ca taṇḍulam paryavanahyati
translated: And because those beings enjoyed the unploughed, unplanted rice by collecting it, then the rice became covered with husks and chaff.

original: lūno lūno na prativirohaty abalaś ca prajñāyate /
analyzed: lūnaḥ lūnaḥ na prativirohati abalaḥ ca prajñāyate
translated: When cut, it did not grow back, and it became known as weak.🔽The rice that was established in the forests and groves

analyzed: ṣaṇḍa vana ṣaṇḍeṣu vyavasthitaḥ śāliḥ
translated: Rice is located in the thickets of the forest.

original: atha te satvāḥ saṃgamya samāgamya śocanti klāmyanti paridevante vayaṃ sma bhavantaḥ pūrvaṃ SBV I 🔽rūpiṇo bhavāmo manomayā avikalā ahīnendriyāḥ sarvāṅgapratyaṅgopetāḥ śubhā varṇasthāyinaḥ
analyzed: atha te satvāḥ saṃgamya samāgamya śocanti klāmyanti paridevante vayam sma bhavantaḥ pūrvam  rūpiṇaḥ bhavāmaḥ manaḥ mayāḥ avikalāḥ ahīna indriyāḥ sarva aṅga pratyaṅga upetāḥ śubhāḥ varṇa sthāyinaḥ
translated: Then those beings, having come together and assembled, lamented, saying: 'We were formerly...

original: svayaṃprabhā vihāyasaṃgamāḥ prītibhakṣāḥ prītyāhārāḥ dīrghāyuṣo dīrgham adhvānaṃ tiṣṭhāmaḥ /
analyzed: svayaṃprabhāḥ vihāyasaṃgamāḥ prīti bhakṣāḥ prīti āhārāḥ dīrgha āyuṣaḥ dīrgham adhvānam tiṣṭhāmaḥ
translated: we were embodied, mind-made, complete in all our limbs and faculties, well-formed, possessing our own radiance, travelling through the air, feeding on joy, living on rapture, abiding in a state of bliss.

original: teṣām asmākaṃ pṛthivīrasaḥ prādurbhūto varṇasaṃpanno gandhasaṃpanno rasasaṃpannaḥ /
analyzed: teṣām asmākam pṛthivī rasaḥ prādurbhūtaḥ varṇa saṃpannaḥ gandha saṃpannaḥ rasa saṃpannaḥ
translated: For us, the essence of earth appeared, endowed with color, smell, and taste, like pure ghee or butter.

original: te vayaṃ pṛthivīrasaṃ kavaḍīkārāhāropakrameṇa paribhuktā yataś ca pṛthivīrasaṃ kavaḍīkārāhāropakrameṇa paribhuktā tato asmākam kharatvaṃ gurutvaṃ
analyzed: te vayam pṛthivī rasam kavaḍīkāra āhāra upakrameṇa paribhuktāḥ yatas ca pṛthivī rasam kavaḍīkāra āhāra upakrameṇa paribhuktā tatas asmākam khara tvam guru tvam
translated: We, having consumed the essence of earth as solid food, from that time on, coarseness and heaviness

analyzed: ca kāye vakra antam
translated: entered our bodies.

analyzed: yā asau śubhā varṇa nibhā sā antarhitā
translated: That beautiful color disappeared.

analyzed: andhakāram loke prādurbhūtam
translated: Darkness appeared in the world.

original: te vayaṃ tadbhakṣās tadāhārā dīrghāyuṣo dīrgham adhvānaṃ tiṣṭhāmaḥ /
analyzed: te vayam tad bhakṣāḥ tad āhārāḥ dīrgha āyuṣaḥ dīrgham adhvānam tiṣṭhāmaḥ
translated: We, having that as our food, that as our sustenance, lived for a long time, for a very long time.'

original: teṣām asmākaṃ yo 'lpam āhāram āhṛtavān sa varṇavān bhavati /
analyzed: teṣām asmākam yaḥ lpam āhāram āhṛtavān sa varṇavān bhavati
translated: Among them, the one who ate less food became beautiful.

original: yaḥ prabhūtam āhāram āhṛtavān sa durvarṇa ity āhāradvimātratāṃ pratītya varṇadvimātratā prajñāyate /
analyzed: yaḥ prabhūtam āhāram āhṛtavān sa durvarṇaḥ iti āhāra dvi mātra tām pratītya varṇa dvi mātra tā prajñāyate
translated: The one who ate more food became ugly. Thus, due to the difference in the amount of food, the difference in complexion is known.

analyzed: varṇa dvi mātra tāyām satyām satvaḥ satvam avamanyate
translated: When there is a difference in complexion, a being despises another being.

analyzed: hambhoḥ satva varṇavān aham
translated: Hey, being! I am beautiful.

analyzed: durvarṇaḥ tvam iti
translated: You are ugly.

original: teṣām asmākaṃ varṇābhimānikānāṃ satāṃ teṣām eva pāpakānām akuśalānāṃ dharmāṇāṃ samādānahetoḥ pṛthivīraso 'ntarhitaḥ /
analyzed: teṣām asmākam varṇa abhimānikānām satām teṣām eva pāpakānām akuśalānām dharmāṇām samādāna hetoḥ pṛthivī rasaḥ ntarhitaḥ
translated: For us who were conceited about our complexion, due to the adoption of those same evil and unwholesome qualities, the earth's essence disappeared.

original: antarhite pṛthivīrase pṛthivīparpaṭakaḥ prādurbhūto varṇasaṃpanno gandhasaṃpanno rasasaṃpannaḥ /
analyzed: antarhite pṛthivī rase pṛthivīparpaṭakaḥ prādurbhūtaḥ varṇa saṃpannaḥ gandha saṃpannaḥ rasa saṃpannaḥ
translated: When the earth's essence disappeared, an earth-paddy plant appeared, endowed with color, smell, and taste.

original: teṣām asmākaṃ varṇābhimānikānāṃ satāṃ teṣām eva pāpakānāṃ akuśalānāṃ dharmāṇāṃ samādānahetoḥ pṛthivīparpaṭako 'ntarhitaḥ /
analyzed: teṣām asmākam varṇa abhimānikānām satām teṣām eva pāpakānām akuśalānām dharmāṇām samādāna hetoḥ pṛthivīparpaṭakaḥ ntarhitaḥ
translated: For us who were conceited about our complexion, due to the adoption of those same evil and unwholesome qualities, the earth-paddy plant disappeared.

original: antarhite pṛthivīparpaṭake vanalatā prādurbhūtā varṇasaṃpannā gandhasaṃpannā rasasaṃpannā /
analyzed: antarhite pṛthivīparpaṭake vana latā prādurbhūtā varṇa saṃpannā gandha saṃpannā rasa saṃpannā
translated: When the earth-paddy plant disappeared, a forest creeper appeared, endowed with color, smell, and taste.

original: teṣām asmākaṃ varṇābhimānikānāṃ satāṃ teṣām eva pāpakānāṃ akuśalānāṃ dharmāṇāṃ samādānahetoḥ vanalatā antarhitā /
analyzed: teṣām asmākam varṇa abhimānikānām satām teṣām eva pāpakānām akuśalānām dharmāṇām samādāna hetoḥ vana latā antarhitā
translated: For us, who were proud of our caste, when we undertook those same evil and unwholesome things, the wild creepers disappeared.

analyzed: antarhitāyām
translated: When the wild creepers disappeared,

original: vanalatāyām akṛṣṭoptaṃ taṇḍulaphalaśāliḥ prādurbhūtaḥ akaṇa atuṣṭaḥ śuddhaḥ śuciḥ caturaṅgulaḥ paryavanaddhaḥ /
analyzed: vana latāyām a kṛṣṭa uptam taṇḍula phala śāliḥ prādurbhūtaḥ a kaṇaḥ a tuṣṭaḥ śuddhaḥ śuciḥ caturaṅgulaḥ paryavanaddhaḥ
translated: unploughed and unseeded rice appeared, without powder or husk, pure and clean, with grains the size of a chickpea, and enclosed in husks.

original: sa sāyaṃ lūnaḥ kālyaṃ pakvaś ca bhavati prativirūdhaś ca iti lūnaḥ lūnaḥ prativirohati alūnaś ca prajñāyate sma /
analyzed: sa sāyam lūnaḥ kālyam pakvaḥ ca bhavati prativirūdhaḥ ca iti lūnaḥ lūnaḥ prativirohati a lūnaḥ ca prajñāyate sma
translated: It was harvested in the evening and ripe in the morning, and when harvested it grew back again, and what was not harvested could be seen to have grown even more.

original: te vayaṃ tadbhakṣās tadāhārā dīrghāyuṣo dīrgham adhvānaṃ tiṣṭhāmaḥ /
analyzed: te vayam tad bhakṣāḥ tad āhārāḥ dīrgha āyuṣaḥ dīrgham adhvānam tiṣṭhāmaḥ
translated: We lived on that food, subsisting on it, and we had a long life-span and remained there for a long time.

original: yataḥ vayam akṛṣṭoptaṃ taṇḍulaphalaśāliṃ saṃnidhikāraparibhogena paribhuktavantaḥ /
analyzed: yatas vayam a kṛṣṭa uptam taṇḍula phala śālim saṃnidhi kāra paribhogena paribhuktavantaḥ
translated: But when we stored up and hoarded that unploughed and unseeded rice,

original: tato 'sya śāleḥ kuṇaś ca tuṣaś ca tanḍulaṃ SBV I
analyzed: tatas sya śāleḥ kuṇaḥ ca tuṣaḥ ca tanḍulam
translated: then the rice became covered with powder and husk,

analyzed: paryavanahyati
translated: and it was enclosed in husks.

original: lūno lūno na prativirohaty abalaś ca prajñāyate /
analyzed: lūnaḥ lūnaḥ na prativirohati abalaḥ ca prajñāyate
translated: When harvested, it did not grow back again, and it was seen to become weak.

original: upacāror gautamā rājño dakṣiṇe caraṇe piṭako jāto mṛduḥ sumṛdus tadyathā tūlapicur vā karpāsapicur vā /

translated: It did not cause any harm.

analyzed: paripāka anvayāt sphuṭitaḥ
translated: Due to the sequence of ripening, it burst open.

original: kumāro jāto 'bhirūpo darśanīyaḥ prāsādiko dvādriṃśatā mahāpuruṣalakṣaṇaiḥ samalaṅkṛtaḥ /

translated: A prince was born, handsome, good-looking, and pleasing, adorned with the thirty-two marks of a great man.

original: kīdṛśe kāle bodhisatvā jaṃbūdvīpe pratisandhiṃ gṛhṇanti /🔽utkarṣe vartamanāyāṃ prajāyām aśītivarṣasahasrāyuṣi prajāyām ūrdhvaṃ pratisandhiṃ na gṛhṇanti /
analyzed: kīdṛśe kāle bodhisatvāḥ jaṃbūdvīpe pratisandhim gṛhṇanti  utkarṣe vartamanāyām prajāyām aśīti varṣa sahasra āyuṣi prajāyām ūrdhvam pratisandhim na gṛhṇanti
translated: In what kind of time do Bodhisattvas take rebirth in Jambudvipa?🔽They do not take rebirth when the world is in decline, when the lifespan of beings is 80,000 years, or when it is increasing.

analyzed: apakarṣe śata varṣa āyuṣām manuṣyāṇām
translated: They do not take rebirth when the lifespan of humans is 100 years or less.

analyzed: prajāyām arvāk pratisandhim na
translated: They do not take rebirth in the world

analyzed: gṛhṇanti
translated: when it is in decline.

original: kena kāraṇena bodhisatvā aśītivarṣasahasrāyuṣi manuṣyāṇām ūrdhvaṃ pratisandhiṃ na gṛhṇanti /
analyzed: kena kāraṇena bodhisatvāḥ aśīti varṣa sahasra āyuṣi manuṣyāṇām ūrdhvam pratisandhim na gṛhṇanti
translated: For what reason do Bodhisattvas not take rebirth when the lifespan of humans is more than 80,000 years?

analyzed: aśīti varṣa sahasra āyuṣaḥ hi manuṣyāḥ durudvejyāḥ bhavanti
translated: For when the lifespan of humans is 80,000 years, they become difficult to agitate,

original: duḥsaṃvedyā jaḍā mṛdvindriyāḥ pramattāḥ sukhabahulāḥ satyānām abhājanabhūtāḥ /
analyzed: duḥsaṃvedyāḥ jaḍāḥ mṛdu indriyāḥ pramattāḥ sukha bahulāḥ satyānām a bhājana bhūtāḥ
translated: dull, with weak faculties, heedless, full of pleasure, not vessels for the truths.

original: apakarṣe 'py arvāg varṣaśatasya pañcakaṣāyā udriktā bhavanti /
analyzed: apakarṣe pi arvāk varṣa śatasya pañca kaṣāyāḥ udriktāḥ bhavanti
translated: Even in the decline, for less than 100 years, the five corruptions increase.

original: tadyathā āyuḥkaṣāyaḥ kleśakaṣāyaḥ satvakaṣāyo dṛṣṭikaṣāyaḥ kalpakaṣāyaś ca /
analyzed: tat yathā āyuḥ kaṣāyaḥ kleśa kaṣāyaḥ satva kaṣāyaḥ dṛṣṭi kaṣāyaḥ kalpa kaṣāyaḥ ca
translated: Namely, the corruption of lifespan, the corruption of afflictions, the corruption of sentient beings, the corruption of views, and the corruption of the eon.

original: mā me syur atonidānaṃ pare vaktāraḥ pañcakaṣāyodrikte kāle bodhisatvena pratisandhir gṛhīta iti /
analyzed: mā me syuḥ atonidānam pare vaktāraḥ pañca kaṣāya udrikte kāle bodhisatvena pratisandhiḥ gṛhītaḥ iti
translated: May others not say of me, 'The Bodhisattva took rebirth at a time when the five corruptions were increasing.'

original: tathā hi bodhisatvenānādikālīnam anākṣepasaṃvartanīyaṃ karma kṛtam upacitam /🔽avandhyaphaladharmadeśikāś A
analyzed: tathā hi bodhisatvena anādi kālīnam an ākṣepa saṃvartanīyam karma kṛtam upacitam  avandhya phala dharma deśikāḥ
translated: For thus, the Bodhisattva has performed and accumulated karma to be reborn that does not lead to rebirth.

analyzed: ca buddhāḥ bhagavantaḥ
translated: And the Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, teach the Dharma that bears fruit without fail.

analyzed: anena kāraṇena bodhisatvāḥ kāla avalokanam kurvanti
translated: For this reason, the Bodhisattvas observe the time.

analyzed: kena kāraṇena kula avalokanam kurvanti
translated: For what reason do they observe the family?

analyzed: bodhisatvasya evam bhavati
translated: The Bodhisattva thinks:

analyzed: kīdṛśe kule bodhisatvāḥ pratisandhim gṛhṇanti iti
translated: In what kind of family do Bodhisattvas take rebirth?

original: paśyati yat kulam uccasaṃmatam anupākruṣṭacāritraṃ yāvad āsaptamaṃ mātāmahaṃ paitāmahaṃ yugam upādāyeti /
analyzed: paśyati yat kulam ucca saṃmatam an upākruṣṭa cāritram yāvat āsaptamam mātāmaham paitāmaham yugam upādāya iti
translated: He sees that a family is highly regarded, with unblemished conduct, up to seven generations of maternal and paternal ancestors.

original: tasyaitad abhavad ayaṃ śākyavaṃśa uccakulasaṃmato yāvan mahāsaṃmatam upādāyānupākruṣṭacāritraś ca yanv ahaṃ rājñaḥ śuddhodanasya kule pratisandhiṃ
analyzed: tasya etat abhavat ayam śākya vaṃśaḥ ucca kula saṃmataḥ yāvat mahā saṃmatam upādāya an upākruṣṭa cāritraḥ ca yanu aham rājñaḥ śuddhodanasya kule pratisandhim
translated: He thinks: This Shakya family is of high birth, highly regarded, up to seven generations of maternal and paternal ancestors, with unblemished conduct. Let me take rebirth in the family of King Shuddhodana.

original: mā me syur atonidānaṃ pare vaktāraḥ pratyavare kule bodhisatvena pratisandhir gṛhīta iti /🔽tathā hi bodhisatvenānādikālīnam anākṣepasaṃvartanīyaṃ karma SBV I
analyzed: mā me syuḥ atonidānam pare vaktāraḥ pratyavare kule bodhisatvena pratisandhiḥ gṛhītaḥ iti  tathā hi bodhisatvena anādi kālīnam an ākṣepa saṃvartanīyam karma
translated: Let others not say because of this: 'The Bodhisattva took rebirth in a low family.'

analyzed: kṛtam upacitam
translated: For the Bodhisattva has performed and accumulated karma that leads to rebirth in a high family, which is not subject to reproach, from beginningless time.

analyzed: avandhya phala dharma deśikāḥ ca buddhāḥ bhagavantaḥ
translated: And the Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, teach the Dharma with fruitful results.

analyzed: anena kāraṇena bodhisatvāḥ vaṃśa avalokanam kurvanti
translated: For this reason, the Bodhisattvas look at the family.

analyzed: kena kāraṇena bodhisatvāḥ strī avalokanam kurvanti
translated: For what reason do the Bodhisattvas look at women?

analyzed: bodhisatvasya evam bhavati
translated: The Bodhisattva thinks:🔽If I were to take rebirth in a high family, I would be subject to the faults of a high family.

original: kīdṛśyā striyāḥ kukṣau bodhisatvāḥ pratisandhiṃ gṛhṇantīti /
analyzed: kīdṛśyāḥ striyāḥ kukṣau bodhisatvāḥ pratisandhim gṛhṇanti iti
translated: In the womb of what kind of woman do Bodhisattvas take rebirth?

original: paśyati yā strī rūpavatī bhavati śīlavatī kulavatī kulinā kulavardhanī pūrvabuddheṣu kṛtapraṇidhānā aho batāhaṃ buddhasya mātā syām iti /
analyzed: paśyati yā strī rūpavatī bhavati śīlavatī kulavatī kulinā kula vardhanī pūrvabuddheṣu kṛta praṇidhānā aho bata aham buddhasya mātā syām iti
translated: He sees that it is a woman who is beautiful, virtuous, of good family, of noble family, who increases the family, who has made prayers to the Buddhas of the past, thinking, Oh, may I be the mother of a Buddha.

analyzed: śaknoti bodhisatvam daśa māsam kukṣiṇā dhārayitum
translated: She is able to carry the Bodhisattva in her womb for ten months.

analyzed: na ca sva artham hāpayati
translated: And she does not abandon her own welfare.

original: tasyaivaṃ bhavati iyaṃ mahāmāyā yāvad āsaptamaṃ mātāmahaṃ mātāmahaṃ paitāmahaṃ yugam upādāyānupākruṣṭacāritrā rūpavatī śīlavatī kulinā kulavardhanī /
analyzed: tasya evam bhavati iyam mahāmāyā yāvat āsaptamam mātāmaham mātāmaham paitāmaham yugam upādāya an upākruṣṭa cāritrā rūpavatī śīlavatī kulinā kula vardhanī
translated: He thinks, This is the Great Illusion, up to the seventh generation of her mother and father, who are of unblemished character, beautiful, virtuous, of noble family, who increases the family.

analyzed: śaknoti bodhisatvam daśa māsam kukṣiṇā dhārayitum
translated: She is able to carry the Bodhisattva in her womb for ten months.

analyzed: na ca sva artham hāpayitum
translated: And she does not abandon her own welfare.

original: tathā hi mahāmāyā pūrvabuddheṣu kṛtādhikārapraṇidhānā aho batāhaṃ buddhamātā syām iti /
analyzed: tathā hi mahāmāyā pūrva buddheṣu kṛta adhikāra praṇidhānā aho bata aham buddha mātā syām iti
translated: For thus the Great Illusion has made offerings to the Buddhas of the past and made prayers, thinking, Oh, may I be the mother of a Buddha.

original: mā ca me syur atonidānaṃ pare vaktāraḥ alakṣaṇasaṃpannāyā striyāḥ kukṣau bodhisatvena pratisandhir gṛhīta iti /
analyzed: mā ca me syuḥ atonidānam pare vaktāraḥ alakṣaṇa saṃpannāyāḥ striyāḥ kukṣau bodhisatvena pratisandhiḥ gṛhītaḥ iti
translated: And let others not say of her, 'The Bodhisattva took rebirth in the womb of a woman who is not endowed with the right characteristics.'

analyzed: tathā hi bodhisatvena anādi kālīnam
translated: For thus, the bodhisattva has [the vow] from beginningless [time].🔽

analyzed: an ākṣepa saṃvartanīyam karma kṛtam upacitam
translated: For the Bodhisattva has performed and accumulated actions that lead to rebirth in the desire realm, which are not to be rejected, and which will not be fruitless.

analyzed: avandhya phala dharma deśikāḥ ca buddhāḥ bhagavantaḥ
translated: And the Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, teach the Dharma that is not fruitless.

analyzed: anena kāraṇena bodhisatvāḥ strī avalokanam kurvanti
translated: For this reason, the Bodhisattvas look at women.

original: atha bodhisatvaḥ pañca vyavalokanāni vyavalokya ṣaṭ kāmāvacarān devāṃs trir anuśrāvayati
analyzed: atha bodhisatvaḥ pañca vyavalokanāni vyavalokya ṣaṭ kāmāvacarān devān tris anuśrāvayati
translated: Then, after the Bodhisattva has looked with the five looks, he announces three times to the six gods of the desire realm:

original: ito 'haṃ mārṣās tuṣitād devanikāyāc cyutvā manuṣyeṣu pratisandhiṃ grahīṣyāmi rājñaḥ
analyzed: itas ham mārṣāḥ tuṣitāt devanikāyāt cyutvā manuṣyeṣu pratisandhim grahīṣyāmi rājñaḥ
translated: From here, sirs, having fallen from the Tusita group of gods, I will take rebirth in the womb of the chief queen of King

analyzed: śuddhodanasya agramahiṣyāḥ kukṣau
translated: Śuddhodana.

analyzed: tasya putra tvam adhigamya amṛtam adhigamiṣyāmi
translated: Having attained the state of being his son, I will attain immortality.

original: yo yuṣmākam amṛtenārthī sa manuṣyeṣu pratisandhiṃ gṛhṇātu bhūyo madhyadeśa iti /
analyzed: yaḥ yuṣmākam amṛtena arthī sa manuṣyeṣu pratisandhim gṛhṇātu bhūyas madhyadeśe iti
translated: Whoever of you desires immortality should take rebirth in the human realm, and again in the central country.

original: evam uktās tuṣitakāyikā devā bodhisatvam idam avocan /
analyzed: evam uktāḥ tuṣita kāyikāḥ devāḥ bodhisatvam idam avocan
translated: When this was said, the gods of the Tusita group said this to the Bodhisattva:

original: yat khalu bodhisatva jānīyā etarhi kalikaluṣo lokaḥ krūrasantānaprajā ākulīkṛtaś ca jaṃbūdvipaḥ ṣaḍbhis tārkikaiḥ ṣaḍbhir ānuśravikaiḥ ṣaḍbhiḥ
analyzed: yat khalu bodhisatva jānīyāḥ etarhi kali kaluṣaḥ lokaḥ krūra santāna prajāḥ ākulīkṛtaḥ ca jaṃbūdvipaḥ ṣaḍbhiḥ tārkikaiḥ ṣaḍbhiḥ ānuśravikaiḥ ṣaḍbhiḥ
translated: If a bodhisattva knows that now the world is in an age of conflict, that people are of a cruel disposition, that the Rose Apple Isle is in turmoil, and that the six logicians, the six teachers, the six non-Buddhists, and the six ascetics are wandering about,

analyzed: tatra ṣaṭ tārkikāḥ katame
translated: What are the six logicians?

analyzed: tat yathā pūraṇaḥ kāśyapaḥ
translated: They are Pūraṇa Kāśyapa,

original: maskarī gośāliputraḥ sañjayī vairaṭṭīputraḥ ajitaḥ keśakaṃbalaḥ kakudaḥ kātyāyano nirgrantho jñātiputra /
analyzed: maskarī gośāliputraḥ sañjayī vairaṭṭīputraḥ ajitaḥ keśakaṃbalaḥ kakudaḥ kātyāyanaḥ nirgranthaḥ jñātiputra
translated: Māskārin Gośālīputra, Sañjayin Vairaṭṭīputra, Ajita Keśakambala, Kakuda Kātyāyana, and Nirgrantha Jñātiputra.

original: ṣaḍ ānusravikāḥ katamas tadyathā kūṭatāṇḍyo brāhmaṇaḥ śroṇatāṇḍyo brāhmaṇaḥ /
analyzed: ṣaṭ ānusravikāḥ katamaḥ tat yathā kūṭatāṇḍyaḥ brāhmaṇaḥ śroṇatāṇḍyaḥ brāhmaṇaḥ
translated: What are the six teachers? They are Kūṭadānta the brahmin, Śroṇadānta the brahmin,

analyzed: cogī brāhmaṇaḥ brāhma āyuḥ brāhmaṇaḥ a
translated: Cūḍā the brahmin, Brahmayu the brahmin,

analyzed: puṣkarasāri brāhmaṇaḥ lohityaḥ ca brāhmaṇaḥ
translated: Puṣkarasārin the brahmin, and Lohitya the brahmin.

analyzed: ṣaṭ pratipattāraḥ katame
translated: What are the six ascetics?

analyzed: tat yathā udrakaḥ rāmaputraḥ
translated: They are Udraka Rāmaputra,

original: arāḍaḥ kālāmaḥ subhadraḥ parivrājakaḥ sañjayī māṇavaḥ asitariṣiḥ urubilvākāśyapaś ca jaṭilaḥ /
analyzed: arāḍaḥ kālāmaḥ subhadraḥ parivrājakaḥ sañjayī māṇavaḥ asitariṣiḥ urubilvākāśyapaḥ ca jaṭilaḥ
translated: Ārāḍa Kālāma, Subhadra the wandering mendicant, Sañjayin the young brahmin, Asita the sage, and Uruvilvā-Kāśyapa the matted-hair ascetic.

original: iha tu bodhisatvasya dvādaśayojanāni dharmaśravaṇārtham āsanaprajñaptiḥ prajñāpyate /
analyzed: iha tu bodhisatvasya dvādaśa yojanāni dharma śravaṇa artham āsana prajñaptiḥ prajñāpyate
translated: Here, a bodhisattva should prepare a seat for listening to the Dharma twelve yojanas away.

analyzed: asmākam ca evam bhavati
translated: And we think like this:

original: yam asmākaṃ tuṣitabhavanastho bodhisatvo dharmaṃ deśayiṣyati taṃ vayaṃ dharmaṃ śrutvā tathā tathā pratipatsyāmahe /
analyzed: yam asmākam tuṣita bhavana sthaḥ bodhisatvaḥ dharmam deśayiṣyati tam vayam dharmam śrutvā tathā tathā pratipatsyāmahe
translated: When the Bodhisattva, dwelling in the Tusita heaven, teaches the Dharma, having heard that Dharma we will practice accordingly.

original: yathāpitad asmākaṃ bhaviṣyati dīrgharātram arthāya hitāya sukhāyeti /
analyzed: yathā apitat asmākam bhaviṣyati dīrgharātram arthāya hitāya sukhāya iti
translated: In that way it will be for our long-term benefit, welfare, and happiness.

original: evam ukto bodhisatvaḥ tuṣitakāyikān devān idam avocat /
analyzed: evam uktaḥ bodhisatvaḥ tuṣitakāyikān devān idam avocat
translated: When this was said, the Bodhisattva said to the Tusita gods:

original: tena hi mārṣā sarvavādyāni prahaṇyantām iti🔽Descent from the Tuṣitas
analyzed: tena hi mārṣā sarva vādyāni prahaṇyantām iti  descent from the tuṣitas
translated: Well then, friends, let all the musical instruments be played.

analyzed: tuṣitakāyikābhiḥ devatābhiḥ sarva vādyāni prahatāni
translated: The musical instruments were played by the Tusita gods.

analyzed: bodhisatvena api saṅkham āpūrya abhihitam
translated: And the Bodhisattva, having filled a conch shell, said:

analyzed: kataraḥ tra mārṣāḥ odārikaḥ śabdaḥ
translated: Which sound is the loudest here, friends?

analyzed: śaṅkha śabdaḥ bhagavan
translated: The conch sound, Blessed One.

original: yathāyaṃ mārṣāḥ śaṅkhaśabdaḥ sarvavādyāny abhibhūyāvasthitaḥ evam evāhaṃ jambūdvīpam avatīrya ṣaṭ tārkikān /
analyzed: yathā ayam mārṣāḥ śaṅkha śabdaḥ sarva vādyāni abhibhūya avasthitaḥ evam eva aham jambūdvīpam avatīrya ṣaṭ tārkikān
translated: Just as, friends, this conch sound remains overpowering all the musical instruments, so too, having descended into Jambudvīpa, I will overcome the six logicians,

analyzed: ṣaṭ ānuśravikān
translated: the six followers of scripture,

analyzed: ṣaṭ ca pratipattrīn abhibhūya amṛtam adhigamiṣyāmi
translated: and the six practitioners, and will attain immortality.

analyzed: amṛtena jagat santarpayiṣyāmi
translated: With immortality I will satisfy the world.

analyzed: anitya tā śaṅkham āpūrayiṣyāmi
translated: I will blow the conch of impermanence.

analyzed: śūnyatā bherīm tāḍayiṣyāmi iti
translated: I will beat the drum of emptiness.🔽I will roar the lion's roar of selflessness.

original: nairātmyasiṃhanādaṃ nadiṣyāmī iti viditvā gāthāṃ bhāṣate /🔽siṃhaikaḥ pramathati naikaśvāpadaughān
analyzed: nairātmya siṃhanādam nadiṣyāmi iti viditvā gāthām bhāṣate  siṃha ekaḥ pramathati na eka śvāpada oghān
translated: Having understood this, he spoke this verse:🔽Alone the lion terrifies many packs of beasts,

analyzed: vajra ekaḥ vilikhati na ekaṣṛṅga śailān
translated: Alone the thunderbolt shatters many peaked mountains,

analyzed: śakra ekaḥ vijayati na eka dānava indrān
translated: Alone Indra conquers many lords of demons,

analyzed: sūrya ekaḥ vimathati na ekam andhakāram
translated: Alone the sun dispels many kinds of darkness.

original: yo yuṣmākaṃ mārṣā amṛtenārthī sa madhyadeśe pratisandhiṃ gṛhṇātu /
analyzed: yaḥ yuṣmākam mārṣāḥ amṛtena arthī sa madhyadeśe pratisandhim gṛhṇātu
translated: Friends, whoever among you desires immortality, let him take rebirth in the Middle Country.

analyzed: ṣaṭsu mahā nagareṣu
translated: In the six great cities, starting from here.

analyzed: śakrasya deva indrasya etat abhavat
translated: Then this occurred to Śakra, Lord of the Gods:

original: ayaṃ bodhisatvo bhagavān mahāmāyāyāḥ devyāḥ kukṣāu pratisandhiṃ grahītukāmaḥ /
analyzed: ayam bodhisatvaḥ bhagavān mahāmāyāyāḥ devyāḥ kukṣau pratisandhim grahītu kāmaḥ
translated: This Bodhisattva, the Blessed One, wishes to take rebirth in the womb of Queen Mahāmāyā.

original: yanv aham asyā ojopasaṃhāraṃ kuryāṃ kukṣiṃ ca viśodhayeyam iti viditvā śakreṇa devānām indreṇa mahāmāyāyā devyāḥ ojopasaṃhāraṃ kṛtavān /
analyzed: yanu aham asyāḥ ojaḥ upasaṃhāram kuryām kukṣim ca viśodhayeyam iti viditvā śakreṇa devānām indreṇa mahāmāyāyāḥ devyāḥ ojaḥ upasaṃhāram kṛtavān
translated: If I were to withdraw his vital energy and purify his womb, having understood this, Śakra, Lord of the Gods, withdrew the vital energy of Queen Mahāmāyā

analyzed: kukṣim ca śodhitavān
translated: and purified her womb.

original: tatas tuṣitabhavanastho bodhisatvaḥ pañcāvalokitāni vyavalokya ṣaṭ kāmāvacarān devāṃs
analyzed: tatas tuṣita bhavana sthaḥ bodhisatvaḥ pañca avalokitāni vyavalokya ṣaṭ kāmāvacarān devān
translated: Then the Bodhisattva, dwelling in the Tusita heaven, surveyed the five [topics] and the six [topics],

original: trir anuśrāvya gajanidarśanena rātryā madhyame yāme māhāmāyāyā devyāḥ kukṣim avakrāntaḥ / āha ca
analyzed: tris anuśrāvya gaja nidarśanena rātryāḥ madhyame yāme māhāmāyāyāḥ devyāḥ kukṣim avakrāntaḥ āha ca
translated: and after thrice proclaiming [his intention] to the gods of the desire realm, he entered the womb of Queen Māyā from the right side in the middle watch of the night, appearing like an elephant. He also said:

analyzed: jagat paritrāṇa kṛta pratijñaḥ
translated: Having made a vow to protect the world,

analyzed: devān upāmantrya tatas cyutaḥ sau
translated: and having taken leave of the gods, he descended from there.

analyzed: ikṣvāku vaṃśe praviveśa kukṣim
translated: He entered the womb of the Ikṣvāku lineage,

analyzed: sandhyā abhra rājīm iva bāla sūryaḥ
translated: like the young sun enters the line of evening clouds.

original: Conception / auspicious signs in the dream
analyzed: conception auspicious signs in the dream
translated: Conception. Auspicious signs in the dream

original: tathā hi mahāmāyā caturaḥ svapnān paśyati /
analyzed: tathā hi mahāmāyā caturaḥ svapnān paśyati
translated: Indeed, Mahāmāyā saw four dreams:

original: ṣaḍdanto me śveto hastināgaḥ kukṣiṃ bhitvā praviṣṭaḥ / 🔽upari vihāyasā gacchāmi /
analyzed: ṣaṣ dantaḥ me śvetaḥ hasti nāgaḥ kukṣim bhitvā praviṣṭaḥ  upari vihāyasā gacchāmi
translated: A six-tusked white elephant king entered my womb, splitting my side.🔽I was flying through the sky.

analyzed: yathā eṣa kampate dhvajaḥ
translated: As this banner trembles,

analyzed: nūnam anarthena bhavitavyam
translated: it is certain that misfortune will befall me.

original: sa samanvāhartuṃ pravṛttaḥ yāvat paśyati bodhisatvaṃ vajrāsane niṣaṇṇam /
analyzed: sa samanvāhartum pravṛttaḥ yāvat paśyati bodhisatvam vajrāsane niṣaṇṇam
translated: He began to reflect and saw that the Bodhisattva was sitting on the vajra seat.

analyzed: tasya etat abhavat
translated: He thought this:

translated: This son of Śuddhodana is sitting on the vajra seat, as long as he does not enter my domain,

analyzed: tāvat asya vighnaḥ kartavyaḥ  iti viditvā uddhūta śiraskaḥ śaṇa śāṭī nivasitaḥ
translated: For that long, an obstacle should be created for him.🔽Having understood this, he raised his head, put on a hempen garment,

analyzed: lekha vāhaka varṇam ātmānam abhinirmāya
translated: and transformed himself into the appearance of a messenger.

analyzed: yena bodhisatvaḥ tena upasaṅkrāntaḥ
translated: He approached where the Bodhisattva was.

analyzed: upasaṅkramya sa saṃbhramaḥ kathayati
translated: Having approached, he said in a state of agitation:

analyzed: kimartham bhavān niṣaṇṇaḥ vatiṣṭhate
translated: Why are you sitting and staying like this?

analyzed: kapilavastu nagaram devadattena avaṣṭabdham
translated: The city of Kapilavastu is besieged by Devadatta.

analyzed: antaḥpuram vidhvaṃsitam
translated: The harem has been destroyed.

analyzed: śākyāḥ praghātitāḥ iti
translated: The Shakyas have been slaughtered.

original: tatra bodhisatvasya trayaḥ pāpakā akuśalā vitarkāḥ samutpannāḥ / tadyathā /
analyzed: tatra bodhisatvasya trayaḥ pāpakāḥ akuśalāḥ vitarkāḥ samutpannāḥ tat yathā
translated: Then three evil, unwholesome thoughts arose in the Bodhisattva, namely:

analyzed: kāma vitarkau  vyāpāda vitarkau
translated: thoughts of desire,🔽thoughts of ill-will,

analyzed: vihiṃsā vitarkaḥ ca
translated: and thoughts of violence.

analyzed: tatra yaśodharā mṛgajā gopikāsu kāma vitarkaḥ
translated: Among them, thoughts of desire arose regarding Yashodhara, Mrigadhara, and Gopika.

analyzed: devadatte vyāpāda vitarkaḥ
translated: Thoughts of ill-will arose regarding Devadatta.

analyzed: tad anujīviṣu śākyeṣu vihiṃśā vitarkaḥ
translated: Thoughts of violence arose regarding the Shakyas who were Devadatta's followers.

analyzed: bodhisatvasya etat abhavat
translated: Then this occurred to the Bodhisattva:

analyzed: kim artham me trayaḥ pāpakāḥ akuśalāḥ vitarkāḥ samutpannāḥ
translated: For what reason have three evil, unwholesome thoughts arisen in me?

analyzed: yāvat paśyati
translated: Up to: he saw:

translated: Māra, the evil one, approached in order to confuse him.

analyzed: tatas bodhisatvasya trayaḥ kuśalāḥ samutpannāḥ
translated: Then three wholesome thoughts arose in the Bodhisattva:

analyzed: tat yathā naiṣkramya vitarkaḥ  a vyāpāda vitarkaḥ
translated: namely, the thought of renunciation,🔽the thought of non-ill will,

analyzed: a vihiṃsā vitarkaḥ ca
translated: and the thought of non-cruelty.

analyzed: bhūyas māraḥ kathayati
translated: Again, Māra said:

analyzed: kim artham tvam bodhi mūle niṣaṇṇaḥ iti
translated: Why are you sitting at the foot of the Bodhi tree?

analyzed: bodhisatvaḥ kathayati
translated: The Bodhisattva said:

analyzed: anuttaram jñānam adhigamiṣyāmi iti
translated: In order to attain unsurpassed knowledge.

analyzed: māraḥ kathayati
translated: Māra said:

original: kumāra kutas tava anuttaraṃ jñānam iti /
analyzed: kumāra kutas tava anuttaram jñānam iti
translated: Young man, where will you get unsurpassed knowledge?

analyzed: bodhisatvaḥ kathayati
translated: The Bodhisattva said:

original: tava tāvat pāpīyan ekaṃ yajñam iṣṭvā kāmadhātvīśvaratvaṃ saṃpannam /
analyzed: tava tāvat pāpīyan ekam yajñam iṣṭvā kāmadhātu īśvara tvam saṃpannam
translated: Evil one, you have performed one sacrifice and attained lordship over the desire realm.

original: prāg eva yena mayā triṣu kalpāsaṅkhyeyeṣv anekāni yajñakoṭīniyutaśatasahasrāṇīṣṭāni /
analyzed: prāk eva yena mayā triṣu kalpa asaṅkhyeyeṣu anekāni yajña koṭī niyuta śata sahasrāṇi iṣṭāni
translated: How much more so I, who have performed countless hundreds of thousands of niyutas of koṭis of sacrifices in three incalculable eons,

analyzed: satvānām ca arthāya śiraḥ kara caraṇa nayana māṃsa rudhira suta dāra hiraṇya suvarṇa ādi parityaktam anuttara jñāna adhigamāya
translated: and for the sake of beings have given away my head, hands, feet, eyes, flesh, blood, children, wife, gold, silver, and so on, in order to attain unsurpassed knowledge.

original: so 'ham anuttaraṃ jñānaṃ nādhigamiṣyāmīti kuta etat /
analyzed: saḥ ham anuttaram jñānam na adhigamiṣyāmi iti kutas etat
translated: How could it be that I will not attain unsurpassed knowledge?

analyzed: evam uktaḥ māraḥ kathayati
translated: Māra, having been thus addressed, said:

original: sa tāvat bhavān eva sākṣī yathā mayā ekena yajñena kāmadhātvīśvaratvaṃ prāptam iti /
analyzed: sa tāvat bhavān eva sākṣī yathā mayā ekena yajñena kāmadhātu īśvara tvam prāptam iti
translated: You yourself are the witness of how I attained lordship over the desire realm through a single sacrifice.

analyzed: bhavataḥ kaḥ sākṣī
translated: Who is your witness?

original: yathā tvayā triṣu kalpāsaṅkhyeyeṣv anekāni yajñakoṭīniyutaśatasahasrāṇīṣṭāni /
analyzed: yathā tvayā triṣu kalpa asaṅkhyeyeṣu anekāni yajña koṭī niyuta śata sahasrāṇi iṣṭāni
translated: As you have performed many hundreds of thousands of millions of sacrifices over three incalculable eons,

analyzed: satvānām ca arthāya śiraḥ kara caraṇa nayana māṃsa rudhira suta dāra hiraṇya suvarṇa ādi parityaktam anuttara jñāna adhigamāya iti
translated: and for the sake of beings, have given up your head, hands, feet, eyes, flesh, blood, children, wife, gold, silver, and so on, in order to attain unsurpassed knowledge.

original: tato bhagavatā cakrasvastikanandyāvartena jālāvanaddhena anekapuṇyaśatanirjātena bhītānām SBV I
analyzed: tatas bhagavatā cakrasvastikanandyāvartena jāla avanaddhena aneka puṇya śata nirjātena bhītānām
translated: Then the Blessed One, with his hand marked with a wheel, swastika, and nandyāvarta, webbed, born from many hundreds of merits, which brings reassurance to the fearful, touched the earth. The earth said:

original: āśvāsanakareṇa kareṇa pṛthivī parāmṛṣṭā pṛthivī sākṣiṇī yathā mayā A
analyzed: āśvāsana kareṇa kareṇa pṛthivī parāmṛṣṭā pṛthivī sākṣiṇī yathā mayā a
translated: Just as I am a witness that you,

analyzed: triṣu kalpa asaṅkhyeyeṣu anekāni yajña koṭī niyuta śata sahasrāṇi iṣṭāni
translated: over three incalculable eons, have performed many hundreds of thousands of millions of sacrifices,

analyzed: satvānām ca arthāya śiraḥ kara caraṇa nayana māṃsa rudhira suta dāra hiraṇya suvarṇa ādi parityaktam iti
translated: and for the sake of beings, have given up your head, hands, feet, eyes, flesh, blood, children, wife, gold, silver, and so on.

original: tataḥ pṛthivīdevatā pṛthivīm udbhidya kṛtāñjalipuṭā śabdam udīrayati /
analyzed: tatas pṛthivī devatā pṛthivīm udbhidya kṛta añjali puṭā śabdam udīrayati
translated: Then the Earth Goddess, having split open the earth, with palms joined, uttered a sound.

original: evam etat pāpīyan yathā bhagavān kathayatīti /
analyzed: evam etat pāpīyan yathā bhagavān kathayati iti
translated: It is just as the Blessed One says, this is evil.

original: evam ukte māraḥ pāpīyāṃs tūṣṇīṃbhūto madgubhūtas srastaskandho 'dhomukho niṣpratibhaḥ pradhyānaparamo vyavasthitaḥ
analyzed: evam ukte māraḥ pāpīyān tūṣṇīṃbhūtaḥ madgu bhūtaḥ srasta skandhaḥ dhomukhaḥ niṣpratibhaḥ pradhyāna paramaḥ vyavasthitaḥ
translated: When this was said, the evil Māra, having become silent, dejected, with shoulders drooping, downcast, without confidence, and absorbed in thought, remained there.

analyzed: sa duḥkhī durmanāḥ saṃlakṣayati
translated: He, being miserable and dejected, thought:

original: evam apy ahaṃ kurvan na labhe śākyasya śuddhodanaputrasya avatāraṃ /
analyzed: evam api aham kurvan na labhe śākyasya śuddhodana putrasya avatāram
translated: Even though I act like this, I do not find an opportunity for the Śākya son of Śuddhodana.

original: yanv aham asya bhūyasyās mātrayā vighnaṃ kuryām ityuktvā prakrāntaḥ /
analyzed: yanu aham asya bhūyasyāḥ mātrayāḥ vighnam kuryām iti uktvā prakrāntaḥ
translated: Well then, let me create even more obstacles for him. Having said this, he departed.

original: tatas tena tisro duhitaraḥ preṣitāḥ tṛṣṇā ca ratā ca ratiś ca /
analyzed: tatas tena tisraḥ duhitaraḥ preṣitāḥ tṛṣṇā ca ratā ca ratiḥ ca
translated: Then he sent his three daughters, Tṛṣṇā, Rati, and Ratiśreṣṭhā.

original: tā rūpayauvanamadamattā divyavastrālaṅkāravibhūṣitā bodhisatvasya purastāt strīsādhyāni vidarśayitrm ārabdhāḥ /
analyzed: tāḥ rūpa yauvana mada mattāḥ divya vastra alaṅkāra vibhūṣitāḥ bodhisatvasya purastāt strī sādhyāni vidarśayitram ārabdhāḥ
translated: They, intoxicated with the pride of beauty and youth, adorned with divine garments and ornaments, began to display the accomplishments of women before the Bodhisattva.

original: tato bodhisatvenopāyakauśalena tathādhiṣṭhitā yathā vṛddhāḥ saṃvṛttāḥ /
analyzed: tatas bodhisatvena upāya kauśalena tathā adhiṣṭhitāḥ yathā vṛddhāḥ saṃvṛttāḥ
translated: Then the Bodhisattva, through skillful means, empowered them in such a way that they became old.

analyzed: yena māraḥ tena upasaṅkrāntāḥ
translated: They approached where Māra was.

original: māras tās tathāvidhā dṛāṭvā viṣaṇṇaḥ kare kapolaṃ datvā cintāparo vyavasthitaḥ /
analyzed: māraḥ tāḥ tathāvidhāḥ dṛāṭvā viṣaṇṇaḥ kare kapolam cintā paraḥ vyavasthitaḥ
translated: Māra, seeing those women in that state, was dejected, and sat down with his cheek in his hand, lost in thought.

original: ko 'sāv upāyas syād yena śākyasya śuddhodanaputrasya tapovighnaṃ kuryām iti /
analyzed: kaḥ sau upāyaḥ syāt yena śākyasya śuddhodana putrasya tapaḥ vighnam kuryām iti
translated: What is the means by which I can create obstacles for the ascetic Śuddhodana's son?

analyzed: ṣaṭtriṃśat bhūta koṭi bala agram ādāya hasti aśva uṣṭra mṛga mahiṣa varāha kukkura ulūka nakula śākhāmṛga ādi ākārāṇām asi tomara bhiṇḍipāla cakra kuntaka dhanuṣpāśa paraśu bhusuṇḍi ādi āyudhānām
translated: Taking an army of thirty-six koṭis of beings, in the forms of elephants, horses, camels, deer, buffaloes, boars, dogs, owls, mongooses, monkeys, and other animals, holding weapons such as black spears, javelins, discuses, lances, bows, nooses, axes, and goads,

original: svayaṃ cākarṇād dhanuḥ pūrayitvā bodhisatvaṃ parivāryāvasthitaḥ /
analyzed: svayam ca ākarṇāt dhanuḥ pūrayitvā bodhisatvam parivārya avasthitaḥ
translated: and himself, drawing his bow to his ear, stood surrounding the Bodhisattva.

original: tato bodhisatvas tān anekarūpān bahuvividhapraharaṇasahitān dṛṣṭvā saṃlakṣayati /
analyzed: tatas bodhisatvaḥ tān aneka rūpān bahu vividha praharaṇa sahitān dṛṣṭvā saṃlakṣayati
translated: Then the Bodhisattva, seeing them in many forms, with various weapons, thought:

original: yas tāvat prākṛtapuruṣeṇa sārdhaṃ saṃraṃbham ārabhate /
analyzed: yaḥ tāvat prākṛta puruṣeṇa sārdham saṃraṃbham ārabhate
translated: One who engages in conflict with an ordinary person,

analyzed: sa pratipakṣam yojayati
translated: he finds an opponent.

original: prāg evāyaṃ kāmadhātvīśvaro yanv ahaṃ pratipakṣaṃ yojayeyam /
analyzed: prāk eva ayam kāmadhātu īśvaraḥ yanu aham pratipakṣam yojayeyam
translated: How much more so this lord of the desire realm? Let me find an opponent.

analyzed: iti viditvā tad upaśamana upāyam cintayitum ārabdhaḥ
translated: Knowing this, he began to think of a means to quell it.

original: māraś ca ṣaṭtriṃśadbhūtakoṭisahito bodhisatvasyopari kuntakacakratomarabhiṇḍipālaśarādi nikṣeptum ārabdhaḥ /
analyzed: māraḥ ca ṣaṭtriṃśat bhūta koṭi sahitaḥ bodhisatvasya upari kuntaka cakra tomara bhiṇḍipāla śara ādi nikṣeptum ārabdhaḥ
translated: And Māra, together with thirty-six koṭis of bhūtas, began to throw spears, discuses, javelins, arrows, and so on, at the Bodhisattva.

analyzed: tatas bodhisatvaḥ maitrīm samāpannaḥ
translated: Then the Bodhisattva entered into loving-kindness.

original: tāni cāsya praharaṇāni divyāny utpalapadmakumudapuṇḍarīkāṇi bhūtvā bodhisatvasya samantāt patitum ārabdhāni /
analyzed: tāni ca asya praharaṇāni divyāni utpala padma kumuda puṇḍarīkāṇi bhūtvā bodhisatvasya samantāt patitum ārabdhāni
translated: And those weapons, having become divine blue lotuses, red lotuses, white lotuses, and white water lilies, began to fall all around the Bodhisattva.

original: tato māra upari vihāyasam abhyudgamya pāṃsuvarṣaṃ varṣitum ārabdhaḥ / tad api SBV I
analyzed: tatas māraḥ upari vihāyasam abhyudgamya pāṃsu varṣam varṣitum ārabdhaḥ tat api
translated: Then Māra, having risen up into the sky above, began to rain down a shower of dust. But that dust

original: divyāni māndārakāṇi puṣpāṇi bhūtvā bodhisatvasyopari nipatitum ārabdhāni /
analyzed: divyāni māndārakāṇi puṣpāṇi bhūtvā bodhisatvasya upari nipatitum ārabdhāni
translated: having become divine coral tree and white water lily flowers, began to fall upon the Bodhisattva.

original: tato māreṇa viṣavāyur utsṛṣṭaḥ upalavarṣaś ca /
analyzed: tatas māreṇa viṣa vāyuḥ utsṛṣṭaḥ upala varṣaḥ ca
translated: Then Māra released a poisonous wind and a shower of rocks.

original: śuddhāvāsakāyikābhir devatābhis tato bodhisatvasyopari parṇikākuṭir abhinirmitā /
analyzed: śuddhāvāsa kāyikābhiḥ devatābhiḥ tatas bodhisatvasya upari parṇikā kuṭiḥ abhinirmitā
translated: But the gods of the Śuddhāvāsa realm magically created a leaf hut above the Bodhisattva.

original: upalavarṣeṇāpi viṣavāyusametena bodhisatvasya na kiñcit kṛtam iti /
analyzed: upala varṣeṇa api viṣa vāyu sametena bodhisatvasya na kiñcid kṛtam iti
translated: And the shower of rocks, even when combined with poisonous wind, did not do anything to the Bodhisattva.

analyzed: māraḥ saṃlakṣayati
translated: Māra thought,

analyzed: kiyat ciram mayā parivārya avasthātavyam
translated: How long must I stay here, surrounding him?

analyzed: śabda kaṇtakāni dhyānāni
translated: The dhyānas are obstructed by sound.

analyzed: bodhivṛkṣam sphaṭika mayam abhinirmāya gacchāmi
translated: I will create a crystal Bodhi tree.

analyzed: tasya patrāṇi nityam śabdam kariṣyanti
translated: Its leaves will always make a sound.

analyzed: tena asya citta ekāgra tā na bhaviṣyati
translated: Because of that, his mind will not be one-pointed.

original: iti viditvā bodhivṛkṣaṃ sphaṭikamayam abhinirmāya śrotrāvadhānatatparo 'vasthitaḥ /
analyzed: iti viditvā bodhivṛkṣam sphaṭika mayam abhinirmāya śrotra avadhāna tatparaḥ vasthitaḥ
translated: Knowing this, he created a crystal Bodhi tree and remained intent on listening.

analyzed: bodhi patrāṇi
translated: The Bodhi leaves

analyzed: sphaṭika mayāni muhur muhur svanitum ārabdhāni
translated: began to sound again and again.

analyzed: bodhisatvaḥ śabda kaṇṭaka tvāt dhyānānām citta ekāgra tām na āsādayati
translated: Because of the thorn of sound, the Bodhisattva did not attain one-pointedness of mind in the meditations.

analyzed: śuddhāvāsa kāyikāḥ devāḥ saṃlakṣayanti
translated: The gods of the Pure Abodes considered:

analyzed: bodhisatvaḥ sphaṭika bodhi patra nisvanāt citta ekāgra tām na āsādayati
translated: The Bodhisattva does not attain one-pointedness of mind because of the sound of the crystal Bodhi leaves.

analyzed: upāya saṃvidhānam kartavyam iti
translated: A means of accomplishing this must be done.

analyzed: tatas taiḥ patram vidhāritam
translated: Then they restrained the leaves.

analyzed: tathā api māra balam tiṣṭhati eva
translated: Nevertheless, Mara's army remained.

analyzed: śuddhāvāsa kāyikāḥ devāḥ saṃlakṣayanti
translated: The gods of the Pure Abodes considered:

original: ayaṃ māraḥ pāpīyāṃś ciraṃ bodhisatvaṃ viheṭhayiṣyati /
analyzed: ayam māraḥ pāpīyān ciram bodhisatvam viheṭhayiṣyati
translated: This evil Mara will harass the Bodhisattva for a long time.

original: iti viditvā tan mārabalaṃ cakravāṭasyopariṣṭāt kṣiptam iti
analyzed: iti viditvā tat māra balam cakravāṭasya upariṣṭāt kṣiptam iti
translated: Knowing this, they threw Mara's army above the wheel-encircling mountain.

analyzed: experinces of suernatural powers
translated: Experiences of supernatural powers

analyzed: tatra bodhisatvaḥ bhagavān urubilvāyām viharati
translated: There the Blessed One, the Bodhisattva, was dwelling in Urubilvā,

original: nadyā nairañjanāyās tīre bodhimūle yuktaḥ sātatye naipakye saṃbodhipakṣeṣu dharmeṣu bhāvanāyogam anuyukto viharati /
analyzed: nadyāḥ nairañjanāyāḥ tīre bodhi mūle yuktaḥ sātatye naipakye saṃbodhi pakṣeṣu dharmeṣu bhāvanā yogam anuyuktaḥ viharati
translated: on the bank of the Nairañjanā River, at the foot of the Bodhi tree, devoted to the practice of meditation on the factors of awakening, continuously and diligently.

original: sa rātryā prathame yāme riddhiviṣayajñānasākṣātkriyāyām abhijñāyāṃ cittam abhinirṇamayati /
analyzed: sa rātryā prathame yāme ṛddhi viṣaya jñāna sākṣātkriyāyām abhijñāyām cittam abhinirṇamayati
translated: In the first watch of the night, he directed his mind to the realization of the supernormal knowledge of the range of psychic powers.

original: so 'nekavidham ṛddhiviṣayaṃ pratyanubhavati /🔽eko bhūtvā bahūdhā bhavati /
analyzed: saḥ na ekavidham ṛddhi viṣayam pratyanubhavati  ekaḥ bhūtvā bahūdhā bhavati
translated: He experienced various kinds of psychic powers.🔽He became one and then many.

analyzed: bahudhā bhūtvā ekaḥ bhavati
translated: He became many and then one.

analyzed: āvirbhāva tirobhāvam jñāna darśanam pratyanubhavati
translated: He experienced the knowledge and vision of becoming visible and invisible.

original: tiraḥ kuḍyaṃ tiraḥśailaṃ tiraḥ prākāram asajjamānena kāyena gacchati /
analyzed: tiras kuḍyam tiras śailam tiras prākāram a sajjamānena kāyena gacchati
translated: He went through walls, through ramparts, through mountains without sticking.

original: tadyathā ākāśe /🔽pṛthivyām unmajjananimajjanaṃ karoti tadyathā udake /
analyzed: tat yathā ākāśe  pṛthivyām unmajjana nimajjanam karoti tat yathā udake
translated: Just as through space.🔽He emerged from the earth and sank into it as if it were water.

analyzed: udake abhinna srotaḥ gacchati
translated: He walked on water without breaking through it

analyzed: tat yathā pṛthivyām
translated: just as on earth.

original: ākāśaṃ paryaṃkena krāmati tadyathā pakṣī śakuniḥ /
analyzed: ākāśam paryaṃkena krāmati tat yathā pakṣī śakuniḥ
